title: firstchaw
author: firstchaw
content: Hi there ðŸ‘‹Please I need some support here. I'm having difficulty withdrawing my USDT on my trust wallet. It was created as a Tron wallet on trust wallet. I have over $600 in USDT but each time I send Tron to the address so I can withdraw the USDT, the Tron immediately gets withdrawn to a particular wallet.What can I do? I feel my wallet is compromised but don't know how. Anyone has a solution here? I'd really appreciate

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: firstchaw on August 28, 2022, 02:41:56 PMI have over $600 in USDT but each time I send Tron to the address so I can withdraw the USDT, the Tron immediately gets withdrawn to a particular wallet.You're looking for a way to stop that automatic withdrawal that keeps transfering Tron out to a different wallet. Truth is that the said wallet with $600 isn't yours, and you know it. You think you can outsmart that scammer who told you they couldn't withdraw that amount and then exposed certain seedphrase that gave you access to the wallet. It's a game plan scammers use now and it's a pity you fell for that cheap trick.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: firstchaw on August 28, 2022, 02:41:56 PMHi there ðŸ‘‹Please I need some support here. I'm having difficulty withdrawing my USDT on my trust wallet. It was created as a Tron wallet on trust wallet. I have over $600 in USDT but each time I send Tron to the address so I can withdraw the USDT, the Tron immediately gets withdrawn to a particular wallet.What can I do? I feel my wallet is compromised but don't know how. Anyone has a solution here? I'd really appreciate Lol. You are describing a the wallet bait of the hacker that contains USDT that has a built in script attached on it. The only to withdraw it is to counter it by another script that will react faster than the scammer set time. I donâ€™t know if this is exactly possible since I donâ€™t have knowledge in coding but the only way to withdraw that amount is to use a script that will do the same as the hacker doing since you have both access on the wallet private key.Btw stop sending free TRX to the hacker.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: AbuBhakar on August 28, 2022, 03:23:05 PMThe only to withdraw it is to counter it by another script that will react faster than the scammer set time. I donâ€™t know if this is exactly possible since I donâ€™t have knowledge in coding but the only way to withdraw that amount is to use a script that will do the same as the hacker doing since you have both access on the wallet private key.That is not the way of those scam works. It is very like the referred scam is a multisig scam, which a relevant thread is being posted: [Warning] Trust wallet tron multi signature scam. You can see some information over there, but to put it simply, the scammer is making some particular account that can't execute any things including transferring any funds. So, the funds are just sitting there, it can only be moved by another account that manages the bait account.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: I often see this in many telegram groups they share their wallet keys like private keys and 12 mnemonic phrases, I still don't know how they make it work so people will be tempted to send TRX to that wallet address to move USDT in the wallet, but sadly the wallet works automatically send TRX to central wallet address from that address, so you want that USDT better forget it now cause it's a scam

comments.author: AnonBitCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: firstchaw on August 28, 2022, 02:41:56 PMHi there ðŸ‘‹Please I need some support here. I'm having difficulty withdrawing my USDT on my trust wallet. It was created as a Tron wallet on trust wallet. I have over $600 in USDT but each time I send Tron to the address so I can withdraw the USDT, the Tron immediately gets withdrawn to a particular wallet.What can I do? I feel my wallet is compromised but don't know how. Anyone has a solution here? I'd really appreciate Feel sad to hear that but its very hard to recover this. Hacker is so wise he use some bot and script which work 24 hours and automatically send Trx . Same case is happen with me in Bnb chain. When ever i send bnb to withdraw my token, bnb automatic send to another address. Some people will ask you to recover and will ask for upfront payment. Don't trust on these People because they are also scammer.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Quote from: firstchaw on August 28, 2022, 02:41:56 PMHi there ðŸ‘‹Please I need some support here. I'm having difficulty withdrawing my USDT on my trust wallet. It was created as a Tron wallet on trust wallet. I have over $600 in USDT but each time I send Tron to the address so I can withdraw the USDT, the Tron immediately gets withdrawn to a particular wallet.What can I do? I feel my wallet is compromised but don't know how. Anyone has a solution here? I'd really appreciate Are you sure the wallet address is originally yours?Â  Or are you baited by scammers into sending TRX to the address in order to withdraw the $600Â  that's in it?If it is yours then, it is no doubt that the wallet holding the $600 is already compromised and it is kinda hard to compete against the script that automates the withdrawal of any TRX that is sent to the address holding $600.Â  You need a script to beat the script.
